triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: Foundation for AI-driven autonomous database management systems that leverage machine learning algorithms.

triples.name: Predictive analytics
triples.relevance: Used to forecast performance issues and optimize database operations before bottlenecks impact business operations.

triples.name: Query optimization
triples.relevance: Paper proposes novel predictive query optimization techniques using deep learning to enhance query execution plans.

triples.name: Deep learning
triples.relevance: Leveraged to enhance query execution plans and reduce latency in predictive query optimization.

triples.name: Database index
triples.relevance: Subject of intelligent indexing techniques that use machine learning to automate index selection and maintenance.

triples.name: Anomaly detection
triples.relevance: Applied for AI-driven anomaly detection to enhance cybersecurity in autonomous database management systems.

triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: Proposed for real-time database optimization by dynamically adjusting system parameters based on rewards.

triples.name: Quantum computing
triples.relevance: Discussed as a future research direction for database acceleration in autonomous database management.

triples.name: Database tuning
triples.relevance: Paper proposes self-tuning mechanisms that leverage AI to analyze workloads and dynamically optimize database parameters.

triples.name: Workload
triples.relevance: Self-tuning capabilities analyze workloads to optimize resource allocation and maintain peak efficiency.

triples.name: Resource allocation (computing)
triples.relevance: Dynamically optimized by AI self-tuning mechanisms to allocate computing resources efficiently.

triples.name: Data governance
triples.relevance: Paper proposes best practices for AI-driven data governance addressing security, compliance, and reliability concerns.

triples.name: Computer security
triples.relevance: Security concerns are addressed through AI-driven anomaly detection and compliance mechanisms in autonomous database systems.
